archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Bourguignon-Style Beef with Buttered Parsley Potatoes and Roasted Green Beans
description: A family-friendly, low-sodium beef and mushroom skillet in a wine-tomato reduction, served with buttered parsley potatoes and lemon-kissed roasted green beans.
prep_steps: Rinse and quarter 2 lb potatoes; keep pieces similar in size.
Trim 12 oz green beans; pat dry.
Peel and slice 2 carrots into 1/4-inch rounds.
Pat dry 1.5 lb beef stew meat; season with black pepper.
cook_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add potatoes and cook until just tender, 12–15 minutes. Drain and keep warm.
On a sheet pan, toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of black pepper. Roast at 425°F until tender with light char, 12–15 minutes. Finish with lemon zest.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a wide pot over medium-high. Brown beef in 2 batches, 3–4 minutes per batch. Transfer to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add onion and carrots; cook 4 minutes, stirring.
Add mushrooms; cook until they release moisture and lightly brown, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in garlic and 2 tbsp tomato paste; cook 1 minute.
Deglaze with 1/2 cup white wine, scraping up browned bits; simmer 1–2 minutes.

Add 1.5 cups water, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, and several grinds of black pepper. Return beef and any juices. Bring to a simmer, then cook gently uncovered, stirring occasionally, 20–25 minutes until beef is tender and sauce is reduced.
Off heat, swirl in 1 tbsp butter for gloss. Remove bay leaves and adjust black pepper to taste.
Toss drained potatoes with 1 tbsp butter and parsley. Plate beef with sauce, potatoes, and roasted green beans.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse and quarter 2 lb potatoes; keep pieces similar in size.
Trim 12 oz green beans; pat dry.
Slice 10 oz mushrooms.
Dice 1 large onion.
Peel and slice 2 carrots into 1/4-inch rounds.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley.
Zest 1 lemon; reserve.
Pat dry 1.5 lb beef stew meat; season with black pepper.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add potatoes and cook until just tender, 12–15 minutes. Drain and keep warm.
On a sheet pan, toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of black pepper. Roast at 425°F until tender with light char, 12–15 minutes. Finish with lemon zest.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a wide pot over medium-high. Brown beef in 2 batches, 3–4 minutes per batch. Transfer to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add onion and carrots; cook 4 minutes, stirring.
Add mushrooms; cook until they release moisture and lightly brown, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in garlic and 2 tbsp tomato paste; cook 1 minute.
Deglaze with 1/2 cup white wine, scraping up browned bits; simmer 1–2 minutes.

Add 1.5 cups water, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, and several grinds of black pepper. Return beef and any juices. Bring to a simmer, then cook gently uncovered, stirring occasionally, 20–25 minutes until beef is tender and sauce is reduced.
Off heat, swirl in 1 tbsp butter for gloss. Remove bay leaves and adjust black pepper to taste.
Toss drained potatoes with 1 tbsp butter and parsley. Plate beef with sauce, potatoes, and roasted green beans.
